title: Arrest made in deadly shooting of Seminole teen
content:
SEMINOLE COUNTY, Okla. —
A man was arrested Monday in connection with the killing of a 17-year-old man in Seminole County.
Officers found Seth Johnson dead at a home on NS 3580 with an apparent gunshot wound, according to a news release. A witness identified as Curtlon Panoske, 19, as a suspect.
Johnson and Panoske were acquaintances, officials said.
Officials said Panoske stole Johnson's 2011 silver Ford Edge and drove to Ardmore. An Ardmore officer pulled over Panoske at an apartment complex on Monroe Avenue Northeast, and he ran.
Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation agents, Seminole County deputies, Carter County deputies and Chickasaw Lighthorse polce officers searched for Panoske on foot. They took him into custody around 8 a.m. Monday after finding him in a backyard in Ardmore.
Panoske was arrested on complaints of first-degree murder, possession of a firearm after a former felony conviction and possession of a stolen vehicle. He was booked into the Carter County Jail and will be taken to the Seminole County Jail.
